Details: Principal Software Development Engineer / Engineering Manager / Group Engineering Manager

Microsoft is a global technology leader committed to empowering every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. Our engineering teams build innovative products and platforms that shape the future of computing, cloud, and artificial intelligence. We are seeking a passionate and experienced Software Development Engineer III (SDE III) to join our dynamic team.

As a Software Development Engineer III (SDE III) at Microsoft, you will be a key technical leader responsible for designing, architecting, and delivering highly scalable, reliable, and performant software solutions. You will lead development initiatives, mentor junior engineers, and collaborate across teams to support Microsoft’s product and business goals. This role is ideal for experienced engineers who thrive in fast-paced environments and have a deep understanding of software engineering principles, systems architecture, and large-scale distributed systems.

Lead the design and development of enterprise-grade software solutions that are scalable, secure, and resilient. Architect and implement microservices-based, distributed systems using modern frameworks and cloud-native technologies. Collaborate with Product Managers (PM), Program Managers (PGM), and stakeholders to gather, analyze, and translate business requirements into technical specifications. Drive technical innovation and excellence by researching, recommending, and adopting new technologies, tools, and methodologies. Own the full Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC), including requirements analysis, design, coding, testing, deployment, and maintenance. Ensure best practices in coding, code reviews, automated testing, and Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment (CI/CD). Troubleshoot and resolve complex production issues with a sense of urgency, ownership, and attention to detail. Optimize application performance, latency, and resource utilization through code optimization, profiling, and tuning. Develop and maintain Representational State Transfer Application Programming Interfaces (RESTful APIs), Service-Oriented Architectures (SOA), and event-driven architectures using technologies such as Kafka, Rabbit Message Queue (RabbitMQ), and Google Remote Procedure Call (gRPC). Work with containerized environments (Docker, Kubernetes) and orchestration tools to deploy and manage applications. Collaborate with Development and Operations (DevOps) and infrastructure teams to automate build, test, and deployment pipelines. Mentor and coach junior engineers, providing technical guidance, code reviews, and career development support. Establish and enforce software engineering standards, including code quality, security, and documentation. Monitor and report on Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) and metrics to drive continuous improvement. Collaborate with cross-functional teams (Quality Assurance (QA), Security, Infrastructure) to ensure seamless integration and delivery of solutions. Contribute to technical documentation, including architecture diagrams, Application Programming Interface (API) documentation, and operational runbooks. Stay current with emerging technologies, industry trends, and best practices in software engineering, cloud computing, and security.

Bachelor of Technology (B.Tech), Bachelor of Engineering (B.E.), Bachelor of Science (B.Sc), Bachelor of Computer Applications (BCA), Master of Technology (M.Tech), Master of Science (M.Sc), Master of Computer Applications (MCA), or a related technical field. 6+ years of hands-on experience in software development, with a proven track record of delivering complex, high-performance systems. Expertise in one or more programming languages such as C#, C++, Java, Python, or JavaScript. Strong understanding of data structures, algorithms, and system design principles. Experience with microservices, distributed systems, and Representational State Transfer Application Programming Interfaces (RESTful APIs). Proficiency with containerization and orchestration tools such as Docker, Kubernetes, and Helm. Familiarity with modern development tools and practices including Git, Azure DevOps, Jenkins, Terraform, Ansible, and Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment (CI/CD) pipelines. Experience with cloud platforms such as Microsoft Azure, Amazon Web Services (AWS), or Google Cloud Platform (GCP). Knowledge of database systems (Structured Query Language (SQL), Not Only SQL (NoSQL)) and data access technologies (Object-Relational Mapping (ORM), etc.). Experience with software testing frameworks (unit, integration, functional, load, and performance testing). Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to debug and optimize complex systems. Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to articulate technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders. Demonstrated leadership and mentoring abilities, with a commitment to fostering a collaborative and inclusive team environment.

Experience with Microsoft Azure services and technologies. Knowledge of Development and Operations (DevOps) and infrastructure automation. Familiarity with event-driven architectures and messaging systems (Kafka, Rabbit Message Queue (RabbitMQ), etc.). Contributions to open source projects or active involvement in tech communities. Experience with front-end technologies (React, Angular, Vue.js) and full-stack development. Understanding of security best practices and regulatory compliance in highly regulated industries. Experience with performance optimization, code profiling, and memory management. Ability to work in an agile development environment and adapt to rapidly changing priorities.

Work on high-impact projects that shape the future of technology. Competitive compensation and comprehensive benefits package. A culture that values innovation, diversity, and collaboration. Access to world-class learning and career development resources. Opportunities for professional growth and leadership advancement. Flexible work arrangements, including remote and hybrid options. Exposure to cutting-edge technologies and industry best practices.
